newsitem.title: USA: Duff & Phelps reviewing CIGNA debt ratings.
newsitem.headline: Duff & Phelps reviewing CIGNA debt ratings.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said Friday it has placed CIGNA Corp's senior debt, subordinated debt and commercial paper ratings under review following its agreement to acquire Healthsource Inc.

Duff & Phelps currently rates CIGNA's senior debt as Single A, its subodinated debt as Single-A-Minus and its commercial paper as D-One. The rating watch includes about $1.3 billion in debt securities, Duff & Phelps said.
CIGNA said Friday it agreed to acquire Healthsource Inc for $21.75 a share in cash. The deal is worth about $1.7 billion, including payment of $250 million of outstanding Healthsource long-term debt.

A final determination on the ratings will be made upon completion of further review of CIGNA's ability to support projected cash flows, debt service requirements and the capital structure of the combined company.
Duff & Phelps said an initial review of the transaction shows Healthsource as an excellent strategic fit with CIGNA's existing health care operations.
"However, the transaction does present certain integration risks and will lead to an increase in financial leverage," Duff & Phelps said in a published statement.
